answerText: Private Lives[10] Private Lives is a play by this author who wrote about Charles Condomine in Blithe Spirit.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 5 | 1 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This play begins with a newlywed man on a terrace telling his wife that she isn't as pretty as his ex-wife and that he can't stand her mother, after which another couple appears on the terrace. [10] Name this play in which the honeymooners and ex-spouses Elyot and Amanda run into each other at a hotel in France.
